topics.body:
*GOD DAMN IT!*
The airstrikes in Syria are already backfiring.  If you're wondering what is going on immediately after the airstrikes in Syria started the rebels disavowed the USA because of the collateral damage

So now no matter who wins the USA has fundamentally made another enemy.  If Assad wins we have a crazy fucking dictator going around killing his people.  If ISIS wins we have a crazy fucking country that won't stop ever until the last one of them is dead.  If the rebels wins we have another country that fucking hates us cause of the shit we do.

And you know what is the most realistic scenario?  All three groups won't lose and they'll perpetually be stuck in a eternal war.  So basically imagine Syria and Northwest quarter of Iraq as three countries perpetually at war and will never stop until they literally run out of people to fight with.

There's only one way the war in Syria and Iraq can end at this point: if there's no one left.

Tl:dr; the war in Syria and Iraq in all probability is going to last for forty more years until there's no one left at all in the areas either from migrating elsewhere or dying.

Honestly we just need to evacuate civilians from the area and let them fight cause they're never ever going to stop ever.


Christ; shit like this is why I'm a technocrat cause we need people in charge that know what the fuck they're actually doing instead of a bunch of bumbling idiots currently in charge.
